div.p:
I beg leave to
return my hearty thanks
for the kind expressions
contained in your
favour of the 2dJany.January
and also for the kind
feeling which prompted
you to bring the subject
of the Homoeopathic system
to my notice. I tried
the whole range of
Homoeopathic globules on
the natives of Africa &
unfortunately without
ever producing or
alleviating a single
symptom. This was the
case also with my father
in law Mr Moffat &
was a cause of regret
inasmuch as these forms
of medicine are so very
portable.

Among Boers, half castes
and others who are
accustomed to use coffee
tea condiments &c the case
was different. There the
globules were often very
useful as there is
at the time of their exhibition
usually a strict enforce
ment of proper regimen.
With this latter I found
bread pills quite as
efficacious in curing
many complaints. And
I consequently became
a little sceptical as to the
value of the globules.
Homoeopathy has done
great good in exploding
the overdrugging system
which prevailed in this
country as it shewed
how much unassisted
nature can do. but
before pinning our
faith to the system
I think it would be fair
for those who believe
in it to shew what
is effected by their
art in contradistinction
to what is effected by
nature. I never met
one who would pretend
to shew this. and as no
effects follow in the
native constitution
where the diet is of the
simplest kind I am disposed
to attribute the effects
you have observed
to the regimen allowing
nature to have fair
play.

I passed through
the usual medical
curriculum but
was not taught
"Allopathy" though
I have seen statements
made by persons
who attended the
same classes to the
effect that they
in adopting the Homoeopathic
system had been converted
from Allopathic
principles. I dont
wonder at your
Lordship speaking with
scorn of the "thing
called Allopathy" for
it must have been
brought under your
notice by those who
believe in Homoeopathy
using a nickname
which they have
invented. I was taught
the Eclectic system
i.e. to choose the
good out of all
the systems - (and
many systems there
have been, each of
which had as much
claim on our regard
for cures effected
as Homoeopathy) - and
to leave the nonsense
as much as possible
alone. I am sensible
of no mental bias
against Homoeopathy
I only wish that I
could find a tenth part
in it of the good some
see therein but I could
not trust my own
life in a serious illness
to it and I hope your
Lordship will not
when you really need
medicine lean on
nature alone

Again thanking your
Lordship for kindly
writing to me I am
